item.description:
Let's meet at the Tully Lake campground parking lot tomorrow afternoon and take a nice scenic hike around Long Pond. Be sure to bring headlamps (just in case) but we should be done in three hours tops.

Some kind of traction is preferred for this hike for your own safety. Winter hiking always presents icy areas and sometimes hidden under the snow. There are small ups and downs on this hike but not really any big hills.


You can upload a map of Long Pond and the area if you wish too....
http://www.nae.usace.army.mil/recreati/tul/Tully%20Lake%20Park%20Map%202009.pdf

Directions to Campground parking lot....
http://www.thetrustees.org/places-to-visit/places-to-stay/tully-lake-campground/tully-directions.html


Directions

Tully Lake Campground
25 Doane Hill Road
Royalston, MA

Latitude: 42.6517
Longitude: -72.2123

From Rt. 2, take Exit 18 and turn left onto Rt. 2A West toward Athol. From the intersection of Rts. 2A and 32 North in Athol, cross the Millers River Bridge and bear left following the signs on Rt. 32 North. Proceed about 4 mi., passing the Tully Dam, and take a right onto Doane Hill Rd. Proceed for 1 mi. Tully Lake Campground is on the right.

Doane's Falls is right there as well for anyone who is interested in the short hike up to the falls after or before the Long Pond Hike. I will not be arriving early though because I will have a late night tomorrow night. The kiosk for Doane's Falls is just a few yards east of the parking lot.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Long Pond 7 mile Loop Hike
